Comments_List: I learned more about Portuguese culture and developed my written, oral, listening, and comprehension skills in Portuguese.
I expanded my knowledge of the Portuguese language.

I took this class as an optional continuation to my study of Portuguese abroad. It was very interesting learning more about the language in connection with the culture. most notably things expanding outside of syntax and spelling. Like learning different vocabulary, colloquial language, and cultural phrases, and music references.

Strengths: very engaging, very small class so it's nice that you get to know your classmates well, mostly discussions in class and written work at home
Weakness: workload not very spread out (barely any homework all semester and 2 major projects that take up A LOT of time)

The course had many more strengths than weaknesses and was engaging at all times. I never felt as if something was simply being given as an assignment for the sake of it. I was engaged at all times and felt prepared to engage with my peers in a language I was somewhat familiar with.
YES if they want to learn Portuguese! Or even if they want an easy language to fulfill their requirement.
I would recommend this course to any student who wants to properly learn a new language.
Definitely, this class was always engaging and fun. The professor really made the course and overall made it an unforgettable experience.
